Vous y jouez le spectre d’un jeune homme observant (passivement ou non) la soirée organisée en son hommage par sa bande. Des répliques bien senties aux dynamiques familières, j’ai fini observateur de ma propre fin d’adolescence.

title: Pull missing responses into Mastodon - blog.thms.uk

last_post.content:
One problem with being on a small instance is that you generally don't see all the replies to posts, you only get the ones that make it to your server via the magic of federation.

The fix has been mastodon_get_replies. It's a script that scans your home timeline periodically and loads in all of the replies to posts that you might otherwise not have seen. It can also backfill past posts from people you follow! It's mostly eliminated the missing posts problem

https://blog.thms.uk/2023/03/pull-missing-responses-into-mastodon

National Academies: We can’t define “race,” so stop using it in science. Use scientifically relevant descriptions, not outdated social ideas. https://arstechnica.com/?post_type=post&p=1924448

"In humans, race is a socially constructed designation, a misleading and harmful surrogate for population genetic differences, and has a long history of being incorrectly identified as the major genetic reason for phenotypic differences between groups. Rather, human genetic variation is the result of many forces—historical, social, biological—and no single variable fully represents this complexity. The structure of genetic variation results from repeated human population mixing and movements across time, yet the misconception that human beings can be naturally divided into biologically distinguishable races has been extremely resilient and has become embedded in scientific research, medical practice and technologies, and formal education."

title: multimodal turn in Digital Humanities. Using contrastive machine learning models to explore, enrich, and analyze digital visual historical collections

last_post.content:
Happy to announce our new article (w. @melvinwevers) in DSH!

We demonstrate that multimodal models, such as #CLIP, offer new possibilities to explore and analyze image–text combinations at scale. We argue that their zero-shot capability will lead to a multimodal turn in DH, allowing scholars to move past the artificial separation of text and images that dominated the field.

https://academic.oup.com/dsh/advance-article/doi/10.1093/llc/fqad008/7078540

#dh #digitalhumanities #computationalhumanities

There is no reasonable path to legally accessing enormous swaths of video game history, *even within libraries and archives*, and it’s because the ESA wants it that way.

title: The Silicon Valley Bank Collapse Should be a Radicalizing Moment

last_post.content:
The Silicon Valley elite did a bank run on their own bank, then spent the weekend warning there’d be hell to pay if regulators didn’t step in to cover their deposits.

For Disconnect, I argue this should be a radicalizing moment that shows why we must dismantle Silicon Valley if we ever hope to develop technology that really builds a better world instead of steering us in the opposite direction.

https://www.disconnect.blog/p/the-silicon-valley-bank-collapse

#svb #tech #banking #vc

title: Robots Aren’t the Solution to Elder Care w/ James Wright - Tech Won't Save Us

last_post.content:
In the mid-2010s, companies warned a wave of automation would eliminate a ton of jobs in the near future. Japan was a key example, where robots were poised to replace elder care workers as the population aged.

This week on #TechWontSaveUs, I talk to @jms_wright about how the rollout of Japan’s elder care robots hasn’t worked out as planned, and if they do anything it will be to deskill and devalue care work, not eliminate it.

https://www.buzzsprout.com/1004689/12443791-robots-aren-t-the-solution-to-elder-care-w-james-wright

#tech #japan #robot #automation

title: Fact Check: José Javier Olivas-Osuna's review of Citizen Lab's CatalanGate report

last_post.content:
Neither Citizen Lab nor AmnestyTech are magical unicorns whose work is beyond reproach. But if you're going to bring criticism, then at the very least it needs to be factually correct. And this testimony about the Catalan report falls short in a lot of places.
